body_html:
I thought it was currently recommended to build from the AMD fork: https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/pytorch

Have things progressed to where pytorch master is a better choice?

A quick check reveals that despite the large number of different commits reported in the AMD fork, the differences are rather small, and probably the AMD fork is slightly more complete for AMD GPUs using HIP.
body_text:
I thought it was currently recommended to build from the AMD fork: https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/pytorch
Have things progressed to where pytorch master is a better choice?
A quick check reveals that despite the large number of different commits reported in the AMD fork, the differences are rather small, and probably the AMD fork is slightly more complete for AMD GPUs using HIP.
body:
I thought it was currently recommended to build from the AMD fork: https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/pytorch

Have things progressed to where pytorch master is a better choice?

A [quick check](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/compare/master...ROCmSoftwarePlatform:master) reveals that despite the large number of different commits reported in the AMD fork, the differences are rather small, and probably the AMD fork is slightly more complete for AMD GPUs using HIP.
